dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Maktau, Kazakhstan is the only place cracking down on these unlicensed social media giveaways.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Maktau, Kazakhstan is the only place cracking down on these unlicensed social media giveaways.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A resident of Aktau has been fined over 800,000 tenge for launching an unlicensed prize giveaway on Instagram while promoting his online course, according to a court ruling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, that's actually a common misconception. This case was specifically in Aktau, not Maktau. And it's happening all over.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, that's actually a common misconception. This case was specifically in Aktau, not Maktau. And it's happening all over.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Right, right, Aktau. So this individual got hit with a massive fine, over 800,000 tenge, for running a giveaway on Instagram.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, right, Aktau. So this individual got hit with a massive fine, over eight hundred thousand tenge, for running a giveaway on Instagram.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: A resident of Aktau has been fined over 800,000 tenge for launching an unlicensed prize giveaway on Instagram while promoting his online course, according to a court ruling.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, uh, he was promoting his online course, "Business from Scratch," and offered prizes like money, phones, even a car to get people interested.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, uh, he was promoting his online course, Business from Scratch, and offered prizes like money, phones, even a car to get people interested.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: On January 16, 2025, the man advertised a course titled Business from Scratch and promised followers a chance to win money, smartphones, and even a car.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Which, you know, seems like a normal marketing tactic, but in Kazakhstan, that's legally considered a lottery.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, seems like a normal marketing tactic, but in Kazakhstan, that's legally considered a lottery.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, such promotions fall under the legal definition of a lottery, which in Kazakhstan can only be organized by licensed operators.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly. And lotteries can only be run by licensed operators there. It's not something just anyone can do from their personal account.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly. And lotteries can only be run by licensed operators there. It's not something just anyone can do from their personal account.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: However, such promotions fall under the legal definition of a lottery, which in Kazakhstan can only be organized by licensed operators.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: The court had all the evidence tooâ€”screenshots from his Instagram, the whole case file. They fined him 825,720 tenge, which is the minimum for individuals under that specific article.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: The court had all the evidence too-screenshots from his Instagram, the whole case file. They fined him eight hundred twenty five thousand, seven hundred twenty tenge, which is the minimum for individuals under that specific article.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The court found the man guilty based on protocol documents, Instagram screenshots, and other case materials. He was fined 825,720 tenge (equivalent to 100 monthly calculation indices), the minimum penalty for individuals under Article 445-1 of the Code of Administrative Offenses.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: Article 445-1 of the Administrative Code, yeah. They did note it was his first offense, so that probably kept it from being even higher.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Article four hundred forty five to one of the Administrative Code, yeah. They did note it was his first offense, so that probably kept it from being even higher.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He was fined 825,720 tenge (equivalent to 100 monthly calculation indices), the minimum penalty for individuals under Article 445-1 of the Code of Administrative Offenses. The court considered the fact that it was his first violation as a mitigating factor.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Still, that's a huge financial hit for what probably felt like a simple promotional idea.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Still, that's a huge financial hit for what probably felt like a simple promotional idea.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: It really makes you think about how different countries regulate online promotions. What's fine in one place can get you a major penalty elsewhere.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really makes you think about how different countries regulate online promotions. What's fine in one place can get you a major penalty elsewhere.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: Absolutely. And with the rise of influencer marketing and online courses, this is gonna be a tricky area for a lot of creators.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Absolutely. And with the rise of influencer marketing and online courses, this is gonna be a tricky area for a lot of creators.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 2
dialogue_turns.text: For sure. You gotta know the local laws before you start giving away cars on the internet.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For sure. You gotta know the local laws before you start giving away cars on the internet.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Speaker 1
dialogue_turns.text: A hard lesson learned for that guy in Aktau.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: A hard lesson learned for that guy in Aktau.
